sentences.en: Criticism can be of great use; we may not like it at the time, but it can spur us on to greater things.
sentences.cn: 批评可能会很有用；我们当时可能不喜欢它，但它能激励我们获取更大成功。

sentences.en: Even a small success would spur me on to greater effort.
sentences.cn: 哪怕是微小的成功也会促使我做出更大的努力.

sentences.en: He must have cooked up his scheme on the spur of the moment.
sentences.cn: 他肯定是一时冲动策划了这个阴谋。

sentences.en: His speech was a powerful spur to action.
sentences.cn: 他的讲话很有鼓动力。

sentences.en: International competition is a spur to modernization.
sentences.cn: 国际间的竞争是走向现代化的动力.

sentences.en: It is the bridle and spur that makes a good horse.
sentences.cn: 要把马练好,缰绳靴刺不可少.

sentences.en: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.cn: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

sentences.en: It wasn't a spur-of-the-moment decision. We discussed it in detail beforehand.
sentences.cn: 这可不是头脑一热作出的决定。我们事先仔细地讨论过。

sentences.en: Lower taxes would spur investment and help economic growth.
sentences.cn: 降低税率将刺激投资，有助于经济增长。

sentences.en: Redundancy is the spur for many to embark on new careers.
sentences.cn: 裁员促使很多人开始从事新事业。

sentences.en: Snap dragons , calceolaria and lark spur will drop their florets rapidly.
sentences.cn: 金鱼草,蒲包花和翠雀花的小花将迅速脱落.

sentences.en: So they've said that passing trade bills with South Korea and Panama and Colombia would help spur growth -- those got done, with significant bipartisan support.
sentences.cn: 所以他们已经说过了，通过贸易法案与南韩和巴拿马和哥伦比亚将有助于刺激增长——那些搞，重要的两党支持。

sentences.en: Such stories serve as a spur to children's imagination.
sentences.cn: 这类故事能激发儿童的想像力.

sentences.en: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.cn: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.en: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.cn: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.en: They admitted they had taken a vehicle on the spur of the moment.
sentences.cn: 他们承认是一时冲动偷走了一辆车。

sentences.en: This book is a spur to the child's imagination.
sentences.cn: 这本书能促进孩子的想象力.

sentences.en: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand.
sentences.cn: 这迫使航空公司对机票大幅打折来刺激需求。

sentences.en: This report could spur some buying in corn futures when the market opens today.
sentences.cn: 这一报告可能会在今天开市后刺激一些人买进玉米期货。

sentences.en: With whip and spur he urged his horse onward.
sentences.cn: 他以马鞭及马刺策马前进.

phrases.phrase: on the spur of the moment
phrases.tran_cn: 一时冲动之下；未加仔细考虑地

trans.tran_cn: 马刺，鞭策，激励，（公路或铁路的）支线
trans.tran_en: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something

trans.tran_cn: 鼓动， 激励，使更快发生，策马前进
trans.tran_en: to make an improvement or change happen faster
to encourage a horse to go faster, especially by pushing it with special points on the heels of your boots
to encourage someone or make them want to do something
